> In other news, gotta love emergent ~~bugs~~ interactions between mods.

lol. Im guessing in the pic, its supposed to the 'The Sun' and not the galactic core? On that note, when I go into EVEs alt-zero manager and pan to the shadow manager and try and select the sun, it pans to the core even tho visually and functionally, the sun is still working properly. prolly has to do with JadeofMaars mention of how scatterer and eve work in defining what the Sun is. in the galacticcore.cfg it shows the core as 'Sun' and in the StockSun.cfg it shows the Sun as 'The Sun'. more specifically, theres this:

stock sun.cfg

blah blah blah lol...

// Custom Settings  

            displayName = The Sun  

            sphereOfInfluence = 2e12

In Eve, the search is for 'Sun', at least in the GUI(not sure about the code) so for now I can see why it'll pan to the core  ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)"). I'm sure its similar with Scatterer. Im curious tho, how many planets does scatterer support for this'illumination source flag'?
This does not appear to function at all, I launch the game fine, but the additional star systems do not appear.

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, ItsJebK said:
> 
> 
> This does not appear to function at all, I launch the game fine, but the additional star systems do not appear.
> 

What are you expecting? If you install Galactic Neighborhood and no supported planet packs, you only get the Neighborhood itself which is about a dozen lonely stars. The mod itself is only half of what you're looking for. When you install its supported planet packs they will get their own stars or will populate some of the lonely default ones.

If nothing changes at all, like you didn't even install it, then there's a problem.

I just realized I had infact downloaded the wrong version of Kopernicus. Apologies for wasting your time.

[@Sigma88](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113260-sigma88/) KSPIE now  offers a way to do a grand tour of the galactic neighborhood, the Bussard Ramjet which can collect it fuel from either interstellar space, above  atmospheres or directly from the local star. Notice that near the edge of every star system Area of Influence  there is an area where the solar wind gradually stop and is compressed into a hydrogen wall.
Is it possible to disable some stars you don't want?

Hi Sigma, I have a problem with Galactic Neighborhood and Scansat. In fact i saw that in the Archives menu i cant find The Sun system, only Galactic Core and few stars. I dont care about this menu but with Scansat im unable to change the big map's reference body and this is really annoying. Is this a known bug ? Is there a way to get rid of it ? Thanks for your feed back and updates you rock

**Edited <time datetime="2018-01-10T23:00:54Z" title="01/10/2018 11:00  PM" data-short="6 yr">January 10, 2018</time> by Djackmix**
hey how does one get OPM to orbit Kerbol again?

It broke my lighting.

[https://imgur.com/kcUeJCz](https://imgur.com/kcUeJCz)

> 
> 
> On 29.1.2018 at 6:23 AM, Aleksey Pschenichnikov said:
> 
> 
> It broke my lighting.
> 

Have the same problem: Lighting in the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> Overview stays at nighttime the entire day. It's fine on launchpad (normal 6 hours day/night cycle) but as soon as you launch something, the planet and the vessel get gradually darker until both look like it's pitch black night. Once the vessel leaves the atmosphere (so around 70km above ground) the planet returns back to normal, but not the vessel. It also doesn't matter if launched at 0:00 or 3:00, the behaviour of the lighting is exactly the same.

This is on an install with only Kopernicus, ModularFlightIntegrator and GalacticNeighborhood, as i was afraid one of my many other mods would be the reason. Problem doesn't appear anymore once i delete GN.

Or, probably nevermind: I just read Sigma88's signature to see what files he needs, and then saw on his discord that he published a new version just an hour ago. I'll check that out first once im off work.

Edit: Just in case if this helps, it appears to be a problem between Kopernicus 1.3.1-3 and GalacticNeighborhood, as everything works fine when Kopernicus 1.3.1-2 is used.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-02-01T17:11:47Z" title="02/01/2018 05:11  PM" data-short="6 yr">February 1, 2018</time> by elpollodiablo**

Currently, im running this(v 0.4.6), scaterrer, <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>, SVE and lots of other mods and after changing "The Sun" to "StockSun" in scaterrer's planetsList my graphics&game seems mostly fine. My major problem is the same [@Djackmix](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/184316-djackmix/) has.   

Will see how it will work with v 0.4.7 \w Kopernicus 1.3.1-3

hi everybody,

GN was never updated for kopernicus 1.3.1-3 so that's why the lighting was off

I've now released a new update that solves this issue.

it also adds new planet packs and now I also wrote an automated installer that can help you install planet packs with GN (and save some ram)

you'll find more info in the github wiki

if you have bugs to report or need support, please use github because I don't look at the forum very often

What does GN auto installer do

Whatever it does, It isn't working

> 
> 
>

> Whatever it does, It isn't working

here are the installation instructions

[https://github.com/Sigma88/Galactic-Neighborhood/wiki/How-To-Install](https://github.com/Sigma88/Galactic-Neighborhood/wiki/How-To-Install)

if you still have issues, make sure you ask on github because I usually don't check this thread

**Edited <time datetime="2018-02-03T20:28:19Z" title="02/03/2018 08:28  PM" data-short="6 yr">February 3, 2018</time> by Sigma88**

So, not sure if this belongs here, the BK or AK thread, but I have GN installed, as well as OWR. When I install AK, the BK star is also spawned, along with Eden in its orbit. [Log and screenies](https://1drv.ms/f/s!AjOhSRn-M-XfjSzNaX3Sr3md-91Z)

I have migrated the OWR pp to within a GN/Planetpack sub folder without issues. all I needed to do was redirect the paths in all the cfgs ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)"). But trying the same with this pack, gave me this strange outcome. I dont really mind the star being there, or eden. But its just a little confusing. Im not positive what the star in BK is called. but, with GN installed, its name will be converted to Novus. the correlation I see is with Eden being there. But I have no scrape of BK even being installed. Interesting right?

the AK folder has an Eden texture, but located in the <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>/texture subfolder, but I didnt see any cfgs for eden..or a 'novus'. Eden also looks almost if not EXACTLY like Kerbin. I dont have <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> installed so any cfg regarding it is skipped?

UPDATE: Ive removed all my editing for OWR and AK, reinstalled AK completely stock, same outcome.

UPDATE: in the add star and planet fix cfg, ive replaced :NEEDS[!BK] with/or added :NEEDS[!BeforeKerbin] so it looks like this : @Kopernicus:AFTER[!BeforeKerbin] in the planet fix cfg OR @Kopernicus:AFTER[Kopernicus]:NEEDS[!BeforeKerbin] in the addstar cfg

im guessing the planetpacks used to be named AK/BK or something along those lines, but ive gotten Novus and Eden to not spawn anymore.
